title: Upgrade all dependencies to their newest versions
Add message definition to publisher message header
body: This fixes dynamic subscribers storing/interpreting the message definition, and therefore recorded bags having empty definitions that do not match the MD5.

title: Either both or one of header md5/type can be '*'.
body: Requiring both to be wildcards to succeed in connection fails with rosbag record which sends the correct md5sum but a wildcard "type".

title: Fix typo (MGS -> MSG) in README.md
body: I spend 10 minutes to solve the problem because i've copied MGS instead of MSG.

title: Diagnostics: CompositeTask adds by ref, not owned.
body: Adding to a CompositeTask via owned tasks means the same task cannot be added to a composite that can be added to an updater. Also seems to prevent adding something (like a `FrequencyStatus`) which is owned by an Arc, as `Arc<FrequencyStatus>` does not `impl Task` AFAICT.

title: Document ROSRUST_MSG_PATH
body:
Closes #105 

It actually worked well once I had figured out what the code was doing. Definitely did not take as long as I was worried it might.

title: Implement Debug, Default and PartialEq for all messages
Better error message when .msg file not found
body:
If a .msg file is not found (e.g. because the root ROS overlay has not been sourced with `source /opt/ros/$ROSDISTRO/setup.bash`), the current error message is a bit confusing, as it focuses on the "unwrap". A novice to the library may think that the error is due to a problem in the code, and not of his own setup:

```
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: proc macro panicked
 --> rosrust_diagnostics/src/msg.rs:4:1
  |
4 | rosrust::rosmsg_include!(diagnostic_msgs / DiagnosticArray);
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = help: message: called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error(Msg("Could not find requested message in provided folders: diagnostic_msgs/DiagnosticArray"), State { next_error: None, backtrace: None })

error: aborting due to previous error
error: Could not compile `camera`.

```

This change makes the message more clearly focused on the root of the problem:

```
error: proc macro panicked
 --> examples/camera/src/msg.rs:1:1
  |
1 | rosrust::rosmsg_include!(sensor_msgs / Image);
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = help: message: message sensor_msgs/Image not found in provided directories
          Directories:
          share
          ../src
          

error: aborting due to previous error
error: Could not compile `camera`.

```

We could also make the message even smarter, by detecting the $ROSDISTRO environment variable, and suggesting the user to source a workspace if it is empty.

title: Adds is_initialized to check for rosrust init state.
body: Without this there's no way to avoid a panic when making a `rosrust` API call.

title: Drop `println` calls in diagnostics
body: Also would be preferable if this didn't call `rosrust::param` repeatedly.

title: Improve threading logic
body:
Crossbeam allowed for some interactions that the standard library didn't.

This allowed reducing threads and making the intent of some channels clearer.

title: Add diagnostics system
body: This should serve the same purpose as `diagnostic_updater` in `roscpp/py`, and is deliberately designed to resemble it as much as possible.

title: Resolve various outstanding issues
body: Fixes #92, fixes #71, fixes #69, fixes #66, fixes #53, fixes #45.

title: Add the majority of integration tests
Adds reserved keyword handling
body: More compact and future proof implementation of #61.

title: Add queue size to publisher and subscriber
Adds queue size to `subscribe`
body: Addresses #68

title: Improve message parsing performance
body:
Collectively these two commits took message parsing from 57% of my image handling node's runtime to < 1%.

There are some `unsafe` blocks in order to handle stream reading without requiring initialization of the memory buffers. This seems unavoidable without alternative APIs.

title: Fix deprecation warnings on nightly.
body: Travis uses nightly Rust which fails currently because of deprecation warnings.

title: Prevent panic on XML RPC client connection failure.
body: The unwraps here bring the whole system down if the XML connection fails.

title: Fix path validation.
body:
- Numbers can be the first char of a subname ('/' divided piece), just not the first character of the whole topic name.

Address issue #71

title: Remove unnecessary syn::Lit::new step in const_token_stream.
body:
- The `syn::Lit::new` call failed on negative numbers, but quoting the Literal directly works fine.

Negative numbers get broken into two literals and parsing fails.

Message we discovered this on: http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/NavSatStatus.html

title: Fix service behavior when the service is an empty input (e.g. `std_srvs/Trigger`)
body:
- Change decoding of service request from a while loop to explicit if statement
- Do not call service handler on tcp probe connection

title: Fixes lack of matching when array is size 1.
body: Registering `/rosout` failed for me on Kinetic because the message returned from the master was an Array of size 1, causing the `while let match` to skip immediately.

title: Allow external connections when warranted.
body:
- Allow external machines to bind if the ROS_HOSTNAME/ROS_IP env vars
  are not set to a local address.

- Makes behavior match that of https://github.com/ros/ros_comm/blob/89ca9a7bf288b09d033a1ab6966ef8cfe39e1002/tools/rosgraph/src/rosgraph/network.py#L246

Addresses issue #55

title: Adds rosrust::shutdown().
body: Matches the rospy and rocpp APIs. Handy for multi-threaded shutdown.

title: Clean up API exports to make it less confusing.
body:
- Exporting `ServicePair as Service` means doing `let srv:
  rosrust::Service = rosrust::service...(...)` gives very confusing
  error messages about associated types.

- Open to not exporting the `api::raii::Service` type into `rosrust`
  but it seems like it should match the behavior of `Client` exports.

title: Replace deprecated rust-crypto lib.
body:
rust-crypto has been replaced by the (RustCrypto)[https://github.com/RustCrypto/] crates. In particular, rust-crypto does not compile on aarch64.

This PR replaces rust-crypto with the newer md-5 crate and the hex crate for encoding.

title: Adds RosMsg trait impl for bool.
body: Attempting to compile a message containing a bool (like `sensor_msgs/CameraInfo`) currently fails because this impl is missing.

title: Switch to using procedural macros for message generation
Fixed publishing and subscribing with other ros client libraries
body:
The message body length field was missing / did not get parsed correctly resulting in publishing / subscribing working between rosrust publishers and subscribers, but not working with publishers/subscribers written with other client libraries.

If I can find some time I'll ake a look at writing some simple integration tests to prevent those kinds of bugs in the future (see #45  ).
